description.narrative: Le projet constitue un des 4 sous programmes du Programme de partenariat pour la gestion durable des terres au Burkina Faso (Country Partnership Programme for Sustainable Land Management - CPP/SLM),
second-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Objective To establish a coordinated decentralized system of sustainable agrosylvopastoral land management in the CentreWest region

1 Number percentage of relevant SLM interventions that are
a planned and
b implemented collaboratively among different stakeholder types
c and that are deemed relevant and effective by evaluation processes
Definitions
a refers to identification counting and planning of SLM interventions relevant to the project both on the ground ie at site level and through enabling action relevant here means that interventions that are either
i spearheaded
ii cosupported or
iii influenced by the project
b refers to the level of collaboration coordination among stakeholders from implementation
c refers to the level of success of SLM interventions implemented visa vis the planned ones with focus on relevance and effectiveness
Means of Verification through the projects SLM interventions database planning and periodic reporting documents plus other indirect means that can be assessed by the MTR and TE and
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014 Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes

comment.narrative:
1a Both enabling and sitelevel SLM interventions in the Centre West region are still to be more carefully identified PRODOC provides but generic guidance
1b No partnership or coordination mechanisms for SLM is in place in the region for implementation
1c The CPPBdM ie the Country Partnership Programme Burkina Faso Boucle du Mouhoun Region CPPBdM Subprogramme in November 2013 and an evaluation schedule was developed
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014 Refer to reporting in 2014 for an explanation on the changes

General target Existence in the region of a sustainable and efficient coordination mechanism for sustainable agrosylvopastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of at least of 75 of SLM interventions in the region at the end of the project
1a The project keeps a thorough database of its SLM interventions and can document their planning and implementation the database issues a count for the number and nature of SLM interventions i spearheaded ii cosupported or iii influenced by the project upon which a benchmark percentage can be calculated
1b The Regional Consultation SLM Framework for the Boucle du Mouhoun Region is in place and meets regularly with good prospects to continue to do so after project end to propose plan foster and review the implementation of SLM interventions
1c An evaluative analysis of SLM interventions registered in the database establishes that at least 75 of them meet at least one of the criteria for the indicator that they are coordinated jointly planned or collaboratively implemented

Target for 1 is generally on the way to being achieved For sub indicators Target achieved for 1a database development target achieved on a rolling basis for 1b the Regional Partnership Platform for SLM is established and meets and progress made towards the target for 1c project provides support for sustainable agrosylvopastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of SLM interventions in the region
Stakeholders on the frontline in terms of SLM in the region representing 30 of Regional Partnership Platform for SLM RPPSLM were involved in the multistakeholder planning and in the evaluation of the implementation of three multistakeholder investment plans developed since 2013
RPPSLM members who cosupported SLM actions in the region STD NGO Administration Consultants Service Providers Suppliers representing 35 of platform members were involved at 50 the implementation of MOUs for the conduct of activities either through the conduct of studies or the promotion and dissemination of SLM best practices on the sites in nine communes of the subprogram intervention area
Estimated at 35 of RPPSLM members 10 territorial communities 13 associations 05 producers organizations benefited from the application of SLM best practices techniques on their sites
b Holding of three 03 sessions of the partnership platform for SLM on the following themes
Alternative conflict management
Sharing of experiences on river bank protection among stakeholders of the region
Climate change and Sustainable Land Management These three sessions enabled the increase and strengthening of the synergy in SLM interventions in the region of Boucle du Mouhoun
c Steering committee members met in two sessions to discuss and ensure the coordination of SLM activities number of actors members of RPPSLM The development of PAIMR and PAIC enabled the joint planning of SLM activities in the region number of actors involved in the PAIMR and PAIC
Through 27 MOUs the actors members of SLM platform collaborated for the implementation of activities Promotion of SLM best practices in 51 villages and the conduct of studies and development of communication tools

General target Existence in the region of a sustainable and efficient coordination mechanism for sustainable agrosylvopastoral land management interventions leading to the coordination and joint planning of at least of 75 of SLM interventions in the region at the end of the project

description.narrative: 2 Elaboration and revision of a regional multistakeholder SLM action plan

comment.narrative: No such planning tool or crossstakeholder concert exists
A regional multistakeholder SLM action plan is elaborated and revised annually through a participatory approach

Target achieved but quality of document remains to be assessed same as last year
Joint development of three 03 regional annual multistakeholder investment plans that of 2015 benefited from the involvement of 30 actors for the framing and consideration of activities of 35 partners members of RPPSLM On Sustainable Land Management The evaluation 2014 plan in which 40 actors were involved revealed a blossoming of synergy in SLM interventions in the region
A regional multistakeholder SLM action plan is elaborated and revised annually through a participatory approach

Target achieved but quality of document remains to be assessed same as last year
Joint development of three 03 regional annual multistakeholder investment plans that of 2015 benefited from the involvement of 30 actors for the framing and consideration of activities of 35 partners members of RPPSLM On Sustainable Land Management The evaluation 2014 plan in which 40 actors were involved revealed a blossoming of synergy in SLM interventions in the region

description.narrative: Outcome 2 Decentralization of SLMNRM functions is effective

3 Number of regional territorial and community institutions that undertake an effective role in SLM and NRM capacity to do so assessed through the application of the capacity development scorecard for SLM to the mentioned
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
We have introduced the capacity element and a way of assessing through the scorecard This was absent in the PRODOC logframe

comment.narrative:
3a No decentralization of SLM and NRM roles
see below for 3b

3a At least 1 regional 5 territorial and 35 community institutions undertake an effective role in SLM and NRM planning rules budget management
see below for 3b

Further progress made towards the target One 01 regional institution mainly the regional partnership platform for sustainable land management set up in 2013 held three 03 new sessions July 2014June 2015 which gathered 180 SLM actors and professionals on themes such as Alternative conflict management Sharing of experiences on river bank protection among stakeholders of the region Climate change and Sustainable Land Management These sessions enabled the orientation and coordination of SLM action planning in Boucle du Mouhoun region Nine 09 territorial institutions mainly communal platforms or consultation frameworks as well as provincial platforms CCP facilitated eight 08 fora for sharing and consultation on texts governing natural resource management law related to land tenure security in rural areas law on pastoralism forest code environmental code for actors to fully play their role on SLM Nineteen 19 community institutions on SLM sites in the nine communes of subprogram intervention area agree on developed space exploitation and management rules based on adopted techniques of SLM best practices Out of 1000 producers targeted 825 Producers among whom more than 400 womens capacities were built in order to improve the productivity of their activities The capacities of more than 900 actors representing territorial collectivities technical services general administrative structures working in the area of SLM of the region were built to fully play their role on NRMSLM Annually partnership actors develop regional multistakeholder investment plan on SLM PAIMRSLM in order to ensure the sustainable and peaceful management of natural resources of Boucle du Mouhoun region The participation of the subprogram in the capitalization of National Rural Sector Program achievements Agriculture livestock Environment in the regional Directorates with same monitoringevaluation tools opens prospects to harmonize monitoringevaluation system on SLM in the region

3a At least 1 regional 5 territorial and 35 community institutions undertake an effective role in SLM and NRM planning rules budget management
see below for 3b

description.narrative: 4 The number of SLM interventions that have adopted the common goal and targets of the harmonized M and E system and agreed to use it for monitoring their achievements

comment.narrative: There is no synergy among the actions and investment related to SLM in the region
75 of SLM initiatives in the region shared the common goal and targets of the harmonized M and E system and contribute to its achievement

description.narrative: Outcome 3 Best SLM and soil reclamation practices are widely promoted and disseminated across the region
5a Surface of farm land pastoral areas river banks and wetlands under SLM systems

comment.narrative: 5a surface is yet to be defined for retained project sites

5a Surface area under SLM in the BM Region
In the PRODOC this is what had been proposed
TOTAL 200000 hectares of land as follows
30000 ha of irrigated and farm land
100000 ha of pastoral areas
50000 ha of river banks
20000 ha of wetlands

Target basically achieved with 273390 ha but experience with SLM practices over a few seasons is considered necessary for consolidation The contribution of the subprogram to the achievement of this target at this stage is 273390 ha which is an increase of 107540 ha over the period from July 2014 to June 2015
Furthermore while waiting for the midterm evaluation of the subprogram in 2015 which will enable the revision of certain targets in terms of surface area where SLM practices are being tested during the present phase we highlight major progress made

5a Surface area under SLM in the BM Region
In the PRODOC this is what had been proposed
TOTAL 200000 hectares of land as follows
30000 ha of irrigated and farm land
100000 ha of pastoral areas
50000 ha of river banks
20000 ha of wetlands

Target basically achieved with 273390 ha but experience with SLM practices over a few seasons is considered necessary for consolidation The contribution of the subprogram to the achievement of this target at this stage is 273390 ha which is an increase of 107540 ha over the period from July 2014 to June 2015
Furthermore while waiting for the midterm evaluation of the subprogram in 2015 which will enable the revision of certain targets in terms of surface area where SLM practices are being tested during the present phase we highlight major progress made

description.narrative: 5b Percentage of producers successfully applying innovative technologies tested and adapted to SLM in the region now broken down by type of technology

comment.narrative: 5b Few if any to be determined at project start
5b 50 of targeted farmers are applying SLM in their fields

Not possible to adequately report on this indicator as a percentage because the target universe has not been set and some calculations are missing We know that to date 825 producers of communes from subprogram area of intervention apply SLM best practices in their farms with the interventions of CPPBMH We do not know exactly how much a percentage of these households represent visavis the total target population
5b 50 of targeted farmers are applying SLM in their fields

Not possible to adequately report on this indicator as a percentage because the target universe has not been set and some calculations are missing We know that to date 825 producers of communes from subprogram area of intervention apply SLM best practices in their farms with the interventions of CPPBMH We do not know exactly how much a percentage of these households represent visavis the total target population

description.narrative:
6 Number of practical SLM documents produced and widely disseminated within the region eg best practices field guides local innovations lessons learned leaflets radio series
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014
We have moved this indicator It would be better placed under Outcome 3 in the current project setting

comment.narrative: Few and poorly disseminated
At the end of the subprogram at least 5 goodquality documents and 15 IEC products are elaborateddisseminated with various stakeholders participating in them

The numerical target is surpasses but the quality of products remain to be independently assessed We report In addition to the first two documents developed over the period 20132014 one 01 good quality document on SLM mainly the study report on past SLM experiences underway in the Boucle du Mouhoun region was developed Five 05 types of IEC outputs mainly 15 Radio programs 1000 posters 500 leaflets 1500 Teeshirts 200 additional calendars were produced for the sensitization of SLM actors in the region
At the end of the subprogram at least 5 goodquality documents and 15 IEC products are elaborateddisseminated with various stakeholders participating in them
